result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Antonio Caban was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING OCTOBER 30, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA and DV surcharges.  To be paid during period of probation.  Bail to apply.  If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds.  Balance paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.  
All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.

DNA sample previously provided.
Court advised defendant:   of penalties for violation of No Contact Order; and due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession; and due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with J.R.M. unless approved by Children's Court Orders, if Children's Curt not involved then no contact unless approved by Court or agent.
No contact with firearms.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Cooperate with Children's Court Orders.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: reflects 05-25-2017 Notes entry change to commitment start date and sentence credit

The court received a phone call from the agent..  Per the agent, the entry of 05/19/2017 should reflect that the effective date of the defendant's commitment should have started on 04/26/2017, therefore, he has 24 days credit.
cab

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 35 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date, effective 04/20/2017, credit for 30 days; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.   Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

Per the agent's request, case is calendared for a probation review hearing on 05/19/2017 at 1:30 p.m.
ADA Flynn and Kiaie contacted to have the defendant produced from MSDF.
cab

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart. Sarah Zwoc supervised by Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 3 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with J.R.M. unless approved by children's court, if children's court not involved then no contact unless approved by court or agent.
-Cooperate with Children's Court Orders.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, bail to apply, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-DNA sample previously provided.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter. Received & Filed, Amended Information. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
AMENDED INFORMATION: 
COUNT 1: Physical Abuse of A Child (Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Abbey DeSiato and Owen M. Piotrowski for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Projected Guilty Pea Hearing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Projected Guilty Plea Hearing to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & Motion In Limine.

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Matthew James Torbenson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JRM (6/16/08), UNLESS AS APPROVED PER CHILDREN'S COURT ORDER.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Luis Antonio Caban in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
